channel.title: Na.Strings on R for the rest of us
channel.description: Recent content in Na.Strings on R for the rest of us

item.title: Na.omit
item.description: na. strings The argument na.string= "" saved me a lot of work today. Happy I came across this in Stack Over Flow relatively quickly. http://stackoverflow.com/questions/24172111/change-the-blank-cells-to-na. My data set apparently has hidden spaces and the na.omit function was not removing these observations. As a result, my factor levels were messed up and my table summaries were awful. It is fun to learn new things.
